ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An overview on public health issues in the past 50-ish years, especially the roles and relationships between the public, media, and scientists
Communication and the ability to create and present presentations spontaneously
I gained a lot of understanding of the public health space in the United States and beyond. It was interesting to read and discuss about topics that affect our world everyday.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Sometimes it's not very well structured and discussions aren't very productive. Some topics may be more suitable for Prof Bazell to give a lecture on. It's a thought-provoking class that introduces you to the existence of a lot of problems, but you don't actually learn much. 
The midterm and final projects are very flexible and you have the chance to investigate sth of your choice which nice. Group presentations on the other hand are somewhat painful.

Strength: Great people and engaging at times 

Weaknesses: none

Strength: very engaging, insightful professor, organized 

Weakness: (honestly there aren't a lot)

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: An excellent course for those who want to learn more about public health issues while building experience in writing research papers without diving too deep into the technical side of things.

Yes if you're looking for an easy science credit. If you want to actually get into public health maybe this is not the class. That said, it's what you make of it - Prof Bazell has lots of experience and if you're willing to reach out I'm sure you could learn a lot from him.
Yes, especially if you are looking into the healthcare field

Yes! I absolutely loved taking this course and was excited to attend each and every class. I was not only engaged by the content but my fellow like-minded peers and professor made the class mentally stimulating.
yes learned a lot about current issues in health in America and also global. also had the opportunity to explore and was encouraged to research different health issues that weren't covered in class
